intro: Euphrasia spatulifolia, commonly known as the spoonleaf eyebright, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. Its leaves are broad and spoon-shaped, giving it its common name, and it has hairy stems that help retain moisture. Euphrasia spatulifolia is often found in areas with rich, loamy soil and is known for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal medicine.
